CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested by the police .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) decided to place the applicant in pre - trial detention in view of the reasonable suspicion that he had stolen CARDINAL ORG cars as a member of an organised criminal gang . The applicant appealed against this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) dismissed his appeal .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s pre - trial detention was prolonged on DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE . The court relied on the reasonable suspicion against the applicant and on the severity of the penalty that might be imposed , making it probable that the applicant would obstruct the proceedings and attempt to put pressure on witnesses .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against all those decisions and applied to be released from detention , but to no avail .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE ORG further prolonged the applicant ’s detention on remand , giving identical reasons for its decisions as on previous occasions .

CARDINAL . As the length of the applicant ’s detention had reached the statutory time - limit of DATE laid down in Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure ( Kodeks postępowania karnego ) ORG made several applications to ORG for the applicant ’s detention to be prolonged beyond that term . On DATE and DATE ORG granted the application . The court justified its decisions with reference to the reasonable suspicion that the applicant had committed the offences and the complexity of the case , which concerned an organised criminal gang . The court also held that the measure was justified by the severity of the sentence to which the applicant was liable . On both occasions , however , the court decided to prolong the applicant ’s detention for a period shorter than had been requested by the trial court and instructed it to intensify its efforts to finish the trial , given that the most severe preventive measure had been applied to the applicant for a lengthy period .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG prolonged the applicant ’s detention until DATE , reiterating the grounds given previously .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to release the applicant from detention and to place him under the supervision of the police . The court considered that it could not be excluded that the applicant would be sentenced to a prison term amounting to the period he had already spent in detention on remand . The court also found that police supervision would secure the proper course of the proceedings . On DATE the applicant was released from detention .

CARDINAL . In DATE the trial court held CARDINAL hearings . On DATE it gave a judgment . The applicant was convicted of membership of an organised criminal gang involved in stealing cars and of having stolen CARDINAL LOC . He was sentenced to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment .
CARDINAL . The applicant lodged an appeal against the judgment . On DATE ORG quashed the impugned judgment and remitted the case .
CARDINAL . The proceedings are still pending before the trial court .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice concerning the imposition of pre - trial detention ( aresztowanie tymczasowe ) , the grounds for its extension , release from detention and rules governing other “ preventive measures ” ( środki zapobiegawcze ) are set out in the ORG ’s judgments in the cases of ORG v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE and PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE .
